item.title: EXTRAPERITONEAL Radical Prostatectomy for Prostate Cancer
item.description: What is Radical Prostatectomy? Radical prostatectomy is one of the primary treatment options for prostate cancer.

item.title: Diabetes and bladder dysfunction
item.description: Doctor Wu’s most frequently asked question during outpatient consultations: “Doctor, my recent urinary frequency has become more severe.

item.title: Risk Factors of Prostate Cancers
item.description: Recent news reports state that King Charles III of the United Kingdom will undergo surgery for benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH).

item.title: What is Prostate-Specific Antigen (PSA)?
item.description: What is PSA? PSA stands for Prostate-Specific Antigen, and it is one of the most common tests ordered by urologists.

item.title: Olaparib: a new medication for metastatic prostate cancer
item.description: Treatment for Metastatic Prostate Cancer For metastatic prostate cancer, commonly used treatments include hormonal therapy, chemotherapy, and novel hormonal agents.

item.title: Surgical Treatment for Inguinal Hernias
item.description: Currently, there are three common types of hernia repair surgeries Traditional Hernia Repair Surgery: Involves a 4 to 5 centimeter incision at the inguinal area, separating the hernia sac, and subsequently stitching and fixing a hernia mesh.

item.title: Surgical Treatment for Inguinal Hernias
item.description: Currently, there are three common types of hernia repair surgeries Traditional Hernia Repair Surgery: Involves a 4 to 5 centimeter incision at the inguinal area, separating the hernia sac, and subsequently stitching and fixing a hernia mesh.

item.title: Is surgery necessary for inguinal hernias?
item.description: How should Hernias be treated? Inguinal hernias are protrusions of the peritoneum, and the only effective treatment is surgical repair.

item.title: What is inguinal hernia?
item.description: What is a “Hernia”? What is a “Hernia”? Hernia refers to organs being out of their normal position.

item.title: Da Vinci robotic assisted en bloc resection of multiple urologic organs
item.description: What is en bloc resection of multiple urologic organsï¼Ÿ The en bloc resection of multiple urologic organs refers to the “bilateral nephrectomy with bilateral ureterectomy and radical cystectomy.

item.title: Refractory overactive bladder, really refractory?
item.description: Common symptoms of overactive bladder syndrome include urinary frequency, urgency, nocturia, and even urge incontinence.
